content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Search for a portable air conditioner on Amazon suitable for a room size of 300 sq ft, with energy efficiency rating, and compare the prices of the top three search results.  Please interact with https://www.amazon.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To search for a portable air conditioner on Amazon, I should use the search bar. The textbox for entering the search query is labeled [1], and the "Go" button for executing the search is labeled [2].
Action: Type [1]; portable air conditioner 300 sq ft energy efficient
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.2
token: : Type [1]; portable air conditioner 300 sq ft energy efficient

content: Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search results for portable air conditioners are displayed. To refine results to only show models suitable for around 300 sq ft, I should use the "299 to 399 ft²" filter (label [30]). This will ensure the results are most suitable for a 300 sq ft room.
Action: Click [30]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The results are now filtered to show portable air conditioners suitable for rooms between 299 to 399 sq ft. I can see the first two relevant product listings, but need more details (including prices for the first listing, energy efficiency, and possibly the third result) to compare the top three. I should scroll down to see more listings and check for necessary information.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I now see the first three products in the filtered results for portable air conditioners suitable for around 300 sq ft. I have the price for the second product ($116.99 for the NOMEY Evaporative Air Cooler), but the other two listings (Hisense and AIRO brands) only show their titles and a "See options" or another price label, with "2 new offers" as a link which might lead to specific price details. To compare prices, I need to check the exact prices for the first and third units, starting with the Hisense model.
Action: Click [3]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The Hisense 8,000 BTU Portable Air Conditioner product page is loaded, but it does not display a price immediately. There is a message that this item cannot be shipped to the selected delivery location. To find the price and other details (especially energy efficiency rating), I should scroll down on this page, as Amazon often displays price and specifications further down.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The product details (brand, capacity, cooling power) are visible, but the price and energy efficiency rating are still not displayed. These details are often further down the page, especially on Amazon product pages. I should continue scrolling down to find the price and energy efficiency information for this portable air conditioner.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The energy efficiency information is found: "Inverter Technology: Energy efficient (up to 40% more efficiency)" for the Hisense unit, which is suitable for around 350 sq ft. However, the price still hasn’t appeared. The price is usually either at the top or just above the product image; it may also appear on the right-side buy box, but that is currently hidden due to the shipping restriction. I should go back to the previous search result list to collect the price and then repeat with the remaining products.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I now have the price and energy efficiency information for the Hisense unit ($116.99, energy efficient up to 40%). The second unit (NOMEY) was previously noted at $116.99, but is not visible here and might have been replaced by AIRO, which shows "$259.00 (2 new offers)" but the exact specs and energy efficiency details need confirmation. I should click on "2 new offers" (label [11]) to see the exact price options for the AIRO product.
Action: Click [11]
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The AIRO Portable Air Conditioner (8000 BTU) has two price options: $259.00 (AIRO Direct) and $406.89 (Amazon.com). The lowest price ($259.00) is the most relevant for comparison. I now have price data for the Hisense ($116.99) and AIRO ($259.00). I need to retrieve the price and energy efficiency rating for the third product, the Dreo Portable Air Conditioner (shown below in previous screenshots).
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.9
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The AIRO model pricing is clearly visible. To find the third model (Dreo Portable Air Conditioner) price and energy efficiency, I need to scroll further down, since only a portion of the next product is currently visible.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.92
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The third product listing is partially visible at the bottom of the screenshot, but the product name, details, and price are not yet readable. I need to scroll further down to fully reveal the details for the third portable air conditioner.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.93
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The third product is now a bit more visible, but the product name, price, and specifications are still not completely shown in the screenshot. I need to scroll further to reveal the complete information for the third portable air conditioner.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.94
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The third product listing is still only partially visible. The product image is visible, but the name, price, and any details regarding energy efficiency rating are not yet fully readable. Further scrolling is necessary to reveal these details.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.95
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The next product's image and part of its box are visible, but the full product name, price, and energy efficiency details are still hidden below. I need to scroll further down so the listing is fully shown and I can gather all the required information.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.96
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The next product is still only partially visible, with just its image showing in the lower part of the screen. The product name, price, and energy efficiency information are still not displayed. Another scroll is needed to fully display the third product's details.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.97
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The third product is still not fully visible, with only its image in view and no readable text for name or price. I need to keep scrolling to see the full details and complete the price/efficiency comparison.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.98
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The product listing for the third portable air conditioner is still not fully visible. Only its image is somewhat in view, but the product title, price, and details remain outside the displayed area. One more scroll should reveal the necessary information.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.98
